refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: A barycenter is the center of mass of two or more objects and is located under the Solar System folder in the resource tree. The Barycenter object allows you to create a special point that can be used as a reference point or a point to be used for the plots.

listitem.para: The BodyNames field is a list that contains the bodies used to define a barycenter. In a script, the list must be surrounded by curly braces. (i.e. BaryCenterName.BodyNames = { Earth, Luna })
Sun, Mercury, Venus, Earth, Luna, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto. (At least one body must be selected!)
Interacts with the barycenter object selecting it as the origin of the coordinate system or as a primary or secondary point for defining the axes.
It can be selected as a celestial object to be drawn onto the plot, a View Point Reference, or the View Direction within the dialog box.

programlisting.code: Create Barycenter EarthMoonBary; GMAT EarthMoonBary.BodyNames = {Earth, Luna};
